column4: i am booted on rescue mode but i cannot write to /usr/sbin (install/remove packages).  any ideas how i can do this?  permissions are fine 755 and i am using user root
the file system is probably mounted read only
it says permission denied.  it's not read only. i can write everywhere else but to /usr*
please put the output of mount in a pastebin please.
show me the output of id
why are you showing me that
apologies.  it's what i was asking about before.   unable to create `./usr/sbin/sshd': Permission denied
I don't remember the actual question for earlier, sorry
Hmmm it already exists, have you tried remocing it
got it.  thanks for your help all.
I didn't quite pickup full on IntuitiveNipple's comment
